tutorial.description: Run Apps on a Hardware Device

stepElement.section: Please check your Operating System is able to see your Android device. It should show up as a USB drive.
Unplug & Replug. Not all USB cables are created equally, if your device is not detected by the OS, try connecting your device with another cable.
You must enable Developer Options on your phone in order to run your applications on it.

To access these settings, open the Developer options in the system Settings. On Android 4.2 and higher, the Developer options screen is hidden by default. To make it visible, go to Settings > About phone and tap Build number seven times. Return to the previous screen to find Developer options at the bottom.
Enable USB debugging in the device system settings, under Settings > Developer options.
If you do not see your device, please ensure you followed the previous steps and click the Restart button below to check for new devices.
Sorry we could not resolve your issue. Please submit a bug report to help us debug your issues. Please consider running your application on an emulator.
